headline: Adam Kinzinger advocates uneasy alliance' to thwart Trump and his allies in upcoming Republican primaries
author: Associated Press
sentences:

NEW YORK (AP)  In the high-stakes fight for the GOP's future, Rep. Adam Kinzinger, is calling on Democrats and independents to form an uneasy alliance? with Republicans to fight former President Donald Trump's influence.

The new focus on Republican primaries represents a strategic shift for Kinzinger's network, Country First, which spent much of the last year propping up anti-Trump Republican candidates for state and federal office in general elections with varying levels of success.

Nearly two dozen states have what's described as open? primaries that allow voters affiliated with either party to participate, but even in states that close their primary contests to non-Republicans, Kinzinger says there's time for voters to change their political affiliation  at least temporarily  to the GOP.

Because the vast majority of Republican-held congressional seats are not competitive due to gerrymandering and cultural trends, the congressman argues that Trump-backed extremists? can only be stopped in the Republican primaries that decide which candidate appear on the general election ballot.

Kinzinger, one of Trump's fiercest Republican critics in Congress, has directed his political organization to initiate a novel campaign to convince non-Republicans to support anti-Trump Republican candidates in GOP primary contests across the country later this year.

We have to be able to have uneasy alliances, as uneasy as they may be in this moment.?
There are few modern examples of a sitting Republican member of Congress so openly asking Democrats to help take down a former president of his own party.

Kinzinger's plan underscores the extraordinary challenges Trump antagonists face as they fight to purge Trumpism from the GOP using the existing political system, which offers party leaders little control if voters line up behind extremists.

Country First has yet to determine which races to focus on or exactly how to reach the voters it needs to transform Republican primaries, according to co-founder Austin Weatherford, who serves as Kinzinger's chief of staff.
